from mitxgraders import MatrixGrader, FormulaGrader, ListGrader from mitxgraders.comparers import eigenvector_comparer
# A simple answer that will be passed to FormulaGrader expect_value_0 = '-sqrt(1+x^2)' # A custom comparer that will be passed to MatrixGrader expect_vector_0 = { 'comparer_params': [ '[[1, x], [x, -1]]', expect_value_0 ], 'comparer': eigenvector_comparer }
expect_value_1 = 'sqrt(1+x^2)' expect_vector_1 = { 'comparer_params': [ '[[1, x], [x, -1]]', expect_value_1 ], 'comparer': eigenvector_comparer }
grader = ListGrader( answers=[ [expect_value_0, expect_vector_0], [expect_value_1, expect_vector_1] ], # group the first two inputs together, and the last two inputs together grouping=[1, 1, 2, 2], # Each group wil be passed to the ListGrader below subgraders=ListGrader( ordered=True, subgraders=[ FormulaGrader(variables=['x']), MatrixGrader(variables=['x']) ] ) )
Here is the jewel in the crown of ListGrader: the ability to nest ListGraders.
Find the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of the matrix
\[M = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & x \\ x & -1 \end{bmatrix} \]

1st pair: +sqrt(1+x^2), [1+sqrt(1+x^2), x]
2nd pair: -sqrt(1+x^2), [1-sqrt(1+x^2), x]
